alert.note: Alert for Northern Coos; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 22 at 2:59AM EST until November 22 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow and a wintry mix expected. Additional snow accumulations are expected to be elevation-dependent, ranging between 1 inch in southern Coos County up to 7 inches across the higher elevations of western Maine. Sleet accumulations up to one tenth of an inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...In Maine, Central Somerset, Northern Franklin, and Northern Oxford Counties. In New Hampshire, Northern Coos and Southern Coos Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate and occasionally heavy snow will combine with low visibility to create dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
